perturbation.original_text: In order to carry out the intent of the Parties with respect to the recordation of the transfers of any registrations or applications of Honeywell IP or SpinCo IP, as applicable, to the extent the ownership thereof has transferred from a member of the Honeywell Group to a member of the SpinCo Group, or vice versa, pursuant to the Separation Agreement or any other Ancillary Agreement, the Parties shall, and shall cause their respective Group members (as applicable) to, execute intellectual property assignments in a form substantially similar to that attached as Exhibit A1 (the "Patent Assignment Agreement"), Exhibit A2 (the "Trademark Assignment Agreement"), Exhibit A3 (the "Copyright Assignment Agreement"), Exhibit A4 (the "Domain Name Assignment Agreement") and Exhibit A5 (the "Invention Disclosure Assignment Agreement") as well as such additional case specific assignments as deemed appropriate or necessary under applicable Laws (collectively, the "Intellectual Property Assignment Agreements") for recordation with the appropriate Governmental Authority.
perturbation.changed_text: In order to carry out the intent of the Parties with respect to the recordation of the transfers of any registrations or applications of Honeywell IP or SpinCo IP, as applicable, to the extent the ownership thereof has transferred from a member of the Honeywell Group to a member of the SpinCo Group, or vice versa, pursuant to the Separation Agreement or any other Ancillary Agreement, the Parties should use commercially reasonable efforts to execute intellectual property assignments in a form similar to that attached as Exhibit A1 (the "Patent Assignment Agreement"), Exhibit A2 (the "Trademark Assignment Agreement"), Exhibit A3 (the "Copyright Assignment Agreement"), Exhibit A4 (the "Domain Name Assignment Agreement") and Exhibit A5 (the "Invention Disclosure Assignment Agreement") and additional case-specific assignments as they consider helpful for recordation with the appropriate Governmental Authority.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall' to 'should use commercially reasonable efforts' weakens the obligation, making it potentially discretionary. Replacing 'substantially similar' with 'similar to' provides room for deviation. Replacing 'as deemed appropriate or necessary' with 'as they consider helpful' makes the decision subjective.
perturbation.contradicted_law: The Lanham Act, which requires accurate and timely recordation of intellectual property transfers to maintain clear ownership and prevent consumer confusion. The ambiguous wording could lead to incomplete or delayed filings, potentially undermining the Act's purpose.

perturbation.original_text: The relevant assignee Party shall have the sole responsibility, at its sole cost and expense, to file the Intellectual Property Assignment Agreements and any other forms or documents with the appropriate Governmental Authorities as required to record the transfer of any registrations or applications of Honeywell IP or SpinCo IP that is allocated under the Separation Agreement, as applicable, and the relevant assignor Party hereby consents to such recordation.
perturbation.changed_text: The relevant assignee Party will generally be responsible, at its own expense, to file the Intellectual Property Assignment Agreements and other relevant forms with the appropriate Governmental Authorities when practical to record the transfer of registrations or applications of Honeywell IP or SpinCo IP that is allocated under the Separation Agreement, as applicable, and the relevant assignor Party consents to such recordation when feasible.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall have the sole responsibility' to 'will generally be responsible' introduces ambiguity regarding who ultimately bears the responsibility. Adding 'when practical' and 'when feasible' allows for subjective interpretation of when the filing and consent are required, weakening the obligation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: The Lanham Act, which requires accurate and timely recordation of intellectual property transfers to maintain clear ownership and prevent consumer confusion. The ambiguous wording could lead to incomplete or delayed filings, potentially undermining the Act's purpose.

perturbation.original_text: Each Party agrees that it shall comply with all applicable national and international laws and regulations relating to import and/or export control in its country(ies), if any, involving any commodities, software, services or technology within the scope of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party agrees to endeavor to comply with applicable national and international laws and regulations relating to import and/or export control in its country(ies), if any, involving any commodities, software, services or technology within the scope of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By changing “shall comply” to “agrees to endeavor to comply”, the obligation to adhere to import and export control laws becomes non-mandatory. The word 'endeavor' introduces a level of effort rather than a strict requirement, making compliance discretionary.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Various national and international import/export control laws (e.g., Export Administration Regulations (EAR) in the US, sanctions regulations administered by OFAC), which require strict adherence and do not permit discretionary compliance.
